intro: Strophanthus chopraie, commonly known as the African blood lily, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its striking, funnel-shaped flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a velvety texture. Strophanthus chopraie is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has also been used in traditional medicine.
